title: ICE: rustdoc on overlap-not-permitted-for-builtin-trait.rs: unable to fulfill trait

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code code from `./src/test/ui/traits/overlap-not-permitted-for-builtin-trait.rs` ```Rust #![allow(dead_code)] #![feature(negative_impls)] // Overlapping negative impls for `MyStruct` are not permitted: struct MyStruct; impl !Send for MyStruct {} impl !Send for MyStruct {} //~^ ERROR conflicting implementations of trait fn main() {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustdoc 1.50.0-nightly (1c389ffef 2020-11-24) binary: rustdoc commit-hash: 1c389ffeff814726dec325f0f2b0c99107df2673 commit-date: 2020-11-24 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.50.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Unable to fulfill trait DefId(2:2049 ~ core[27a9]::marker::Send) for 'MyStruct': [FulfillmentError(Obligation(predicate=TraitPredicate(), depth=0),Ambiguity)]', /rustc/1c389ffeff814726dec325f0f2b0c99107df2673/compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/auto_trait.rs:193:17 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (1c389ffef 2020-11-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
Backtrace
